definition:
Given a length $k$ and a multiplier $m$, a [*Hurwitz equation*]{} for a
set of integers $x_1, x_2, \ldots , x_k$ states that

$$\sum_{i = 1}^k {x_i}^2 = m\prod_{i = 1}^k x_i.$$

There is no solution to the equation if $m > k$. Solutions can sometimes
be found for $m \leq k$ by starting from a $k$-long set of 1s. The
Markov equation for the Markov numbers has $k = m = 3$.

[2]{} R. K. Guy, [*Unsolved Problems in Number Theory*]{} New York:
Springer-Verlag 2004: D12
